release.action: Fixed issue 56: Inconsistent JAXB/JAX-WS annotations for JAX-WS adapters.
Fixed issue 59: Replace adapter program properties file with bean.
Fixed issue 63: Adapters can now be deployed to AXIS2 in addition to JAX-WS RI (Metro).
There is a new distribution folder that is used at generation time to receive jar and war archives. The generator produces a separate deploy.xml ant script to deploy to the J2EE server.
Fixed issue 50: Remove systematic final attributes on methods.
Fixed issue 51: Remove static attribute on commons logging logger .
Changed some velocity templates so that they can be reused for other targets (ESBs...).
Reimplemented the JAX-WS endpoint implementation using the new Transformer API.
Fixed Issue 3: The generated COBOL samples now have a start level of 2 and incrementation of 1 for their data description items. This should allow handling deep structures (up to 24 levels actually).
Fixed Issue 8: Cixsgen now supports target POJO for proxies (in addition to Web Services).
Fixed Issue 6: Supports multiple COBOL sample HTTP clients (LSHTTAPI, DFHWBCLI, WEBAPI).
Changed the sample COBOL CICS client so that it is consistent with the ones generated for JBoss ESB.

The war build template was assuming the service name is part of the web service implementation package name. This is usually not true. This fixes the issue but assumes there is always a package name when, in theory (never tested), one could generate an implementation without a package name.
Certain templates were referencing the mainframe program properties file using the CixsOperation name where it should be the lowercased program name.

The Generator can now produce Web Service proxies for mainframe clients. These can be deployed with the legstar-c2wsrt runtime to provide mainframe programs with the ability to call oubound Web Services. In this case, the generator produces a Servlet and a COBOL sample client.

The XSLT based generation has been replaced by Velocity macros. The code is easier to maintain and performances are better. There is a new legstar-cixsgen-model project that isolates classes that are common to multiple target platforms (Jaxws, Mule, ...). The Ant Task has been renamed Jaxws2CixsGenerator to show the dependency on Jaxws. There are also minor changes in the Task properties so old Ant script may break with this new version. Test cases have been revised and are more thorough.
Operations now support multiple inputs and multiple outputs where each input or output structure maps to a different JAXB object and also to a CICS Container.
Generated endpoints now use a new XML configuration file. It is called legstar-invoker-config.xml and should be accessible from the classpath (for instance stored in shared/classes).
Generated endpoints are protocol agnostic. You can switch from http to socket and have both direct or pooled sessions to CICS by changing the XML configuration file.
The Hostconnection.properties file no longer exist. It is not referenced from the generated endpoints anymore (content is replaced by XML configuration file).
First version of the generator.
